snippet.title: Why we can't figure out how to regulate Airbnb
snippet.description: The peer-to-peer service and others like it are rapidly blurring the lines between what's personal and what's commercial.

snippet.title: Terps hire Cliff Warren as director of basketball operations
snippet.description: The former Jacksonville head coach and Georgia Tech assistant joins Mark Turgeon's staff.

snippet.title: The Aereo case is being decided by people who call iCloud 'the iCloud'
snippet.description: Yes, it's fun to mock justices who seem clueless about technology. But the truth is that the laws themselves are often far behind technology.

snippet.title: Sahu vs. Sahu vs. Sahu: Indian politicians run 'clone' candidates to trick voters
snippet.description: Dummy candidates is part of a whacky yet disturbing trend in India this election

snippet.title: France unveils plan to fight jihadist threat
snippet.description: French authorities are taking steps to crack down on the flow of young would-be jihadis embarking to fight in Syria's civil war.

snippet.title: The legacies of John Paul II and John XXIII
snippet.description: One was a man who shook the very foundations of the Roman Catholic Church by ushering in revolutionary reforms through the Second Vatican Council of the 1960s. The other was a charismatic globe-trotter who stared down communism and taught the world lasting lessons of how to die.

snippet.title: Was the police response to the Boston bombing really appropriate?
snippet.description: It's time we had a frank discussion about how the government reacted after the Boston Marathon bombing.

snippet.title: Justice Department prepares for clemency requests from thousands of inmates
snippet.description: Attorney General Holder expects thousands of applications from non-violent drug offenders

snippet.title: In questioning Russia's Putin about surveillance, Snowden misses the point
snippet.description: In talking to Putin about surveillance, Snowden drops the ball.

snippet.title: Pro-Russian separatists block monitors from buildings in east Ukraine, diplomats say
snippet.description: Free passage of the monitors and the disarming of separatists were key elements of the agreement reached in Geneva on Thursday.
